channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Brush Fire; INC#1722; 09:57PM; 974 N Mayo St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JOAERx; #MountWashington; Firefighters quickly extinguished a row of at least 6 Cypress trees before any nearby homes were damaged. There was no extension into the brush, and no structures damaged. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is unknown.; FS 55; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 E1 E201 E212 E250 E42 E44 E55 E90 EM1 H3 H4 H5 HA3 HA4 HA5 T1 T12 T50; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Brush Fire; INC#1722; 09:41PM; 974 N Mayo St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JOAERx; #MountWashington; PRELIM: Row of Cypress trees are on fire adjacent to a single family home.; FS 55; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 E1 E201 E212 E250 E42 E44 E55 E90 EM1 H3 H4 H5 HA3 HA4 HA5 T1 T12 T50; CH5; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1569; 07:58PM; 5930 W Pico Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3npFgWV; #MidCity; Firefighters located a grease fire in the fast food kitchen creating large amounts of smoke. It took 20 firefighters just 12 minutes to eliminate the flames. Firefighters will set up blowers to systematically force the smoke out and reintroduce fresh air into the structure. No reported injuries.; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E261 E61 E68 RA68 RA858 T61; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1569; 07:46PM; 5930 W Pico Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3npFgWV; #MidCity; One-story commercial building with moderate smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E261 E61 E68 RA68 RA858 T61; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1164; 03:49PM; 1228 S Flower St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3lKgsIC; #DowntownLA; LAFD's first arriving firefighters ascended ladders to the roof to find the source of the heavy smoke, which was burning rubbish atop the one-story commercial building. Firefighters quickly extinguished the rooftop contents fire, without allowing flames to penetrate down into the building. It took 21 firefighters 15 minutes from the time of alarm to complete the task. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E10 E203 E209 E9 RA13 RA26 SQ21 T10 T3 T9; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1164; 03:34PM; 1228 S Flower St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3lKgsIC; #DowntownLA; One-story vacant commercial building with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E10 E203 E209 E9 RA13 RA26 SQ21 T10 T3 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1686; 11:44PM; 10936 W Otsego St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ZlfyzU; #NorthHollywood; It took 31 firefighters 22 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish flames in the living space and attic of an abandoned one-story single-family home. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation. ; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E289 E76 E86 EM14 RA102 RA76 RA860 T60 T89; CH9; 18; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1686; 11:22PM; 10936 W Otsego St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ZlfyzU; #NorthHollywood; One-story vacant home with fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E289 E76 E86 EM14 RA102 RA76 RA860 T60 T89; CH9; 18; Nicholas Prange

Automobile Fire; INC#1562; 09:42PM; 6000 S Gramercy Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FPeXzN; #ChesterfieldSquare; LAFD is responding to reports of a rubbish/auto (possible RV) fire in the street following several minutes of fireworks explosions in the intersection. No reported injuries. Engine 66 will handle. Nothing further.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E66; CH7; Nicholas Prange

Debris Flow, Small; INC#1404; 07:50PM; 949 N Las Lomas Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3lI8y2m; #PacificPalisades; Approximately 100' x 200' area of hillside sloughed off and made contact with one home on the downhill side, where one family of 8 will be displaced (4 adults and 4 children will stay with loved ones, no need for Red Cross response). One elderly male evacuated from the home above the impacted hillside was evacuated as a precaution. A "Slough Off" is soil sliding, but only a loosing of the uppermost layers. There are no injuries or medical complaints. Firefighters secured all utilities, requested Department of Building and Safety respond to assess the integrity of the structure, and are denying entry to the area for public safety. A grading inspector and geologist will be responding in the morning to assess the situation in daylight.; FS 69; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 E269 E69 T69 UR88; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange
